intro: Mesembryanthemum calculus, commonly known as the "Pillow flower," is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in the morning. Its adaptations to arid environments include a shallow root system and the ability to store water in its leaves. Mesembryanthemum calculus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
